name: Everything Is Hevel
description:
Made originally for #HEN600k and inspired by John Karel windows series. Now a 1 of 1 piece. 

Since October being on this wonderful HEN platform, I've notice themes of skulls being used in a lot of works. 

This fascinates me because around the same time I became aware of the 17th century art term "Vanitas" where the skull was a symbol and representation of a life fullfiled.

The term originally comes from the opening lines of the Book of Ecclesiastes in the Bible and went onto to translate as vanity. But the root meaning in the bible comes from Hebrew word hevel,which means"vapor".

So in Ecclesiastes the line "Vanity of Vanities! All is vanity" does not mean "everything is meaningless" which a lot of people misunderstand it for, but it means "everything is fleating" .. Like the life of a bubble.
